result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oliver C Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Oliver C Smith.  Attorney Matthew Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Court notes that defendant has filed a number of pro se bail motions.
Court holds colloquy with defendant as to pro se filings; defendant has counsel and Court does not typically review pro se filings when represented by counsel.
Court reviews history of case and charges with the parties.
For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any modification to bail at this time.

Case remains scheduled for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Case is adjourned for bail hearing in Branch 28 on October 26, 2022.

Clerk:  jms

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Oliver Smith - #2022006421, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 16:

Defendant Oliver C Smith in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Oliver C Smith in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson and Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
State's motion to join cases for purposes of trial; no objection by defense counsel and granted by the Court.

Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

On July 22, 2022 State and defense counsel appeared before Branch 28 as to Case# 20CF00357 and Case# 22CF02046.

Branch 28 is willing to accept this case for global resolution providing Branch 16 is willing to transfer the case.

This case is adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Oliver C Smith in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones; both appear by video.  Defendant Oliver C Smith in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective J. Lanza.   Stipulation to the identification of the defendant and 20CF357 & 16CM529 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Oliver C Smith not in court, in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The wrong defendant was placed into the booth when the case was called on the record. Due to the lateness of the hour Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oliver C Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Oliver C Smith in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Oliver C Smith in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oliver C Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
